Segment description: The Mac segment includes Apple's line of personal computers and related hardware products. The text references Mac as a distinct revenue item and discusses performance obligations related to hardware and bundled software delivered at the time of sale. Mac is part of the Company's consolidated financial reporting and is a key product contributing to net sales.

Segment description: The Services segment encompasses Apple's offerings related to licensed intellectual property, content, distribution rights, and other service-related commitments. The Company has unconditional purchase obligations for supplier arrangements and content licensing, and manages legal contingencies and supply concentrations affecting this segment. Services is a significant revenue category alongside hardware products.
Primary source: segment Services text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: This segment includes Apple's hardware products related to wearables, home devices, and accessories. The text snippet provides net sales figures for this segment, indicating its contribution to total net sales. It is reported as a separate revenue item alongside iPhone, Mac, iPad, and Services.

Segment description: The iPad segment covers Apple's tablet products and related hardware and bundled software. The Company identifies performance obligations in arrangements involving iPad sales, including hardware and product-related bundled services such as iCloud, Siri, and Maps. iPad is a distinct revenue item contributing to the Company's net sales.

Segment description: The iPhone segment includes Apple's smartphone products and related hardware and services. The text notes that iPhone revenue represents a significant portion of net sales, especially in Greater China. Deferred revenue related to iPhone is also discussed, highlighting its importance in the Company's revenue recognition.

Segment description: The Intelligent Cloud segment includes public, private, and hybrid server products and cloud services that support modern business and developers. It primarily consists of server products and cloud services such as Azure, GitHub, and Nuance Healthcare cloud services, as well as enterprise and partner services including Enterprise Support Services and Microsoft Partner Network. This segment focuses on cloud infrastructure, AI offerings, server software, and professional services to enhance productivity and efficiency for IT professionals and developers.
Key products / services (keywords): Azure; GitHub; Nuance Healthcare; SQL Server; Windows Server; Visual Studio; System Center; Client Access Licenses (CALs); Enterprise Support Services; Industry Solutions; Nuance professional services; Microsoft Partner Network; Learning Experience; Server products and cloud services; Enterprise and partner services
Primary source: 10-K text snippet Intelligent Cloud

Segment description: The More Personal Computing segment comprises products and services that focus on delivering personalized technology experiences. It includes Windows and Devices such as Windows OEM licensing and Surface devices, Gaming with Xbox hardware and content including Xbox Game Pass and Xbox Cloud Gaming, and Search and news advertising through Bing, Microsoft Edge, and Microsoft News. This segment aims to enhance user engagement across devices, gaming platforms, and digital advertising.
Key products / services (keywords): Windows OEM licensing; Surface; PC accessories; Xbox hardware; Xbox content and services; Xbox Game Pass; Xbox Cloud Gaming; Bing; Copilot; Microsoft News; Microsoft Edge; Search and news advertising; Windows and Devices; Gaming
Primary source: 10-K text snippet More Personal Computing

Segment description: The Productivity and Business Processes segment includes a portfolio of productivity, communication, and information services across various devices and platforms. It features Microsoft 365 Commercial and Consumer products and cloud services, LinkedIn with its Talent, Marketing, Premium, and Sales Solutions, and Dynamics products and cloud services including Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM applications. This segment focuses on AI-powered business productivity tools, professional networking, and intelligent cloud-based business solutions.
Key products / services (keywords): Microsoft 365 Commercial; Microsoft 365 Copilot; Enterprise Mobility + Security; Power BI; Exchange; SharePoint; Microsoft Teams; Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance; Microsoft 365 Consumer; LinkedIn; Talent Solutions; Marketing Solutions; Premium Subscriptions; Sales Solutions; Dynamics 365; Power Apps; Power Automate; Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services; Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services; LinkedIn; Dynamics products and cloud services
Primary source: 10-K text snippet Productivity and Business Processes

Segment description: Google Cloud segment includes cloud computing services and infrastructure offerings. It is reported separately from Google Services and Other Bets, reflecting its focus on cloud-based products and services. The segment's operating income increased from $1,716 million in 2023 to $6,112 million in 2024.
Primary source: 10-K Part I, Item 1 Business and Note 15

Segment description: Google Services segment encompasses various consumer and advertiser-facing products and platforms. This includes Google Search and other related services, YouTube advertising, Google Network, and Google subscriptions, platforms, and devices. The segment showed significant operating income growth from $95,858 million in 2023 to $121,263 million in 2024.
Key products / services (keywords): Google Search & other; YouTube ads; Google Network; Google subscriptions, platforms, and devices
Primary source: 10-K Part I, Item 1 Business and Note 15

Segment description: Other Bets segment includes Alphabet's experimental and emerging businesses outside of Google Services and Google Cloud. This segment reported operating losses of $4,095 million in 2023 and $4,444 million in 2024, reflecting ongoing investments in these ventures.
Primary source: 10-K Part I, Item 1 Business and Note 15

Segment description: AWS serves developers and enterprises of all sizes, including start-ups, government agencies, and academic institutions, by offering a broad set of on-demand technology services such as compute, storage, database, analytics, and machine learning. It also provides programs for content creators like authors, independent publishers, musicians, filmmakers, Twitch streamers, skill and app developers to publish and sell content. Additionally, AWS offers advertising services to sellers, vendors, publishers, and authors through sponsored ads, display, and video advertising.
Key products / services (keywords): AWS; sponsored ads; display advertising; video advertising
Primary source: AWS segment text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The International segment includes fulfillment of customer orders through international fulfillment networks, co-sourced and outsourced arrangements in certain countries, digital delivery, and physical stores. It supports sellers by offering programs that enable them to grow their businesses, sell products in Amazon stores, and fulfill orders using Amazon's services. This segment also serves developers and enterprises through AWS and offers programs for content creators.
Primary source: International segment text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The North America segment provides fast, free shipping on tens of millions of items, access to award-winning movies and series, live sports, and other benefits. Customer orders are fulfilled through North America fulfillment networks operated by Amazon, co-sourced and outsourced arrangements, digital delivery, and physical stores. Customer service centers are also operated globally to support this segment.
Primary source: North America segment text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The Family of Apps segment primarily generates revenue by selling advertising placements on its family of apps to marketers. These ads enable marketers to reach people across various marketing objectives such as generating leads or driving awareness. The segment focuses on helping people learn, get things done, create content, and connect with others through its apps.
Primary source: SEC 10-K text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: Reality Labs is a distinct segment reported separately from Family of Apps. While the text does not provide detailed product descriptions, it is implied that Reality Labs involves products related to AI glasses and web-based experiences designed to help people learn, get things done, create content, and connect with others.
Primary source: SEC 10-K text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The Automotive segment focuses on AI model training and inference, data analytics, scientific computing, and 3D graphics with vertical-specific optimizations tailored for industries including automotive. It leverages GPU technology initially designed for simulating human imagination and virtual worlds, now applied to automotive and manufacturing sectors.
Primary source: Automotive text snippet

Segment description: The Data Center segment accelerates compute-intensive workloads such as AI, data analytics, graphics, and scientific computing. It includes compute and networking solutions that scale to tens of thousands of GPU-accelerated servers, supporting modern AI applications. Key platforms include the Hopper computing platform for large language models and Spectrum-X ethernet platform for AI networking.
Key products / services (keywords): Compute; Networking; Hopper computing platform; Spectrum-X ethernet platform
Primary source: Data Center text snippet

Segment description: The Gaming segment is rooted in NVIDIA's invention of the GPU, which revolutionized PC gaming and computer graphics. It includes the CUDA programming model enabling parallel processing for compute-intensive applications and Tensor Core GPUs designed for AI. This segment supports the growth of the PC gaming market and modern AI applications.
Key products / services (keywords): Gaming; CUDA programming model; Tensor Core GPU; GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs
Primary source: Gaming text snippet
